content.description: Easy climbing on good holds, the crux is between the  third and fourth bolts requiring the climber to reach on not so good holds, great climb for the beginning leader or top roper.
content.location: First Climb you will see on Shiprock, farthest left of the three.

content.description: Tallest trad route at PR! The crux is about 20ft off the ground. Great start following thinner crack. Pull over top of a ledge about 30ft up. Continue to follow crack left. Pull over short/ small overhang on great jugs. Follow crack to top on fun 5.6 climbing.
content.protection: single rack: .3-#6. Alpine draws for rope drag. Set up top rope off trees.
content.location: Located on Shiprock. The route is to the right of "Over The Counter"

content.description: First bolt is a bit high, easy climbing up to it. A few tricky moves getting up to the main face. For the most part good pockets on a mostly vertical face, a few bulges.
content.location: From Tarzan go down and to the right. Facing the wall this is the left route. First route to the right of Tarzan, to the left of Over the Counter.

content.description: The crux is between the first and second bolt, one tricky move. Butt bombs onto rocks/tree roots are possible. After the second bolt, great cruising on jugs. When you get to the big hueco stay to the right of it.
content.location: To the right of Somn Somn.

content.description: Ledges and jug pockets lead to pulling a slight bulge. Top out and clip the anchors while standing on a ledge. Usually a very dry route.
content.protection: 4 bolts and 2 bolt anchor with permadraws
content.location: Face Tarzan, turn 90 degrees counterclockwise. There is Jane in all her glory.Â

content.description: Shiprock has two of the longest climbs at Pictured Rocks(Somn Somn, Over the Counter), along with Tarzan a popluar first or second lead.
